p: Alphaviruses form a genus in the family Togaviridae. About 40 different viruses including type and sub-type viruses are members of the genus. Among them are major human pathogens such as chikungunya virus (CHIKV) and viruses of veterinary importance, e.g. Venezuelan equine encephalitis virus. The currently most important Alphavirus of human pathogenicity is CHIKV, which causes significant morbidity and economic losses [1]. Although it has been described and isolated first in 1953 from a febrile person in Tanzania, East Africa [2], currently only few data on the distribution and medical importance of CHIKV and other Alphaviruses in Africa are available.
